statements: SELECT * FROM experiments WHERE id = 1;
SELECT name, description FROM experiments WHERE start_date > '2021-01-01';
SELECT id, name, end_date FROM experiments WHERE researcher_id = 10;
SELECT * FROM experiments WHERE id IN (1, 3, 5);
SELECT name, description, start_date FROM experiments WHERE end_date IS NULL;
SELECT * FROM experiments WHERE id = 1;
SELECT name, description FROM experiments WHERE start_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31';
SELECT id, name, description, start_date, end_date FROM experiments WHERE researcher_id = 5 ORDER BY start_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM experiments WHERE name LIKE '%experiment%' AND end_date > '2022-06-30';
SELECT id, name AS experiment_name, start_date AS start, end_date AS end, researcher_id FROM experiments WHERE researcher_id IN (1, 3, 7) ORDER BY end_date ASC, start_date DESC;

SELECT experiment_name, experiment_date FROM experiments;
SELECT result_data FROM results WHERE result_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM experiments ORDER BY experiment_date DESC;

SELECT experiment_name, experiment_date FROM experiments WHERE experiment_date BETWEEN '2021-01-01' AND '2021-12-31'
SELECT experiment_name, result_data FROM experiments JOIN results ON experiments.id = results.experiment_id WHERE result_data->'success' = 'true'
SELECT experiment_name FROM experiments WHERE experiment_name LIKE '%important%'

SELECT experiment_name, experiment_description, start_date, end_date FROM experiments ORDER BY start_date DESC;

SELECT experiment_name, experiment_date FROM experiments ORDER BY experiment_date DESC;

SELECT experiment_name, researcher_name FROM experiments WHERE experiment_date = '2022-08-15';
SELECT MAX(result_value) AS max_result_value, MIN(result_value) AS min_result_value FROM results;
SELECT researcher_name, research_field, contact_email FROM researchers WHERE researcher_name LIKE 'John%';
SELECT sample_id, sample_type, sample_size FROM samples ORDER BY sample_size DESC;

SELECT experiment_name, started_at FROM experiments WHERE ended_at IS NULL;

SELECT researchers.researcher_name, samples.sample_name FROM researchers JOIN samples ON researchers.id = samples.experiment_id WHERE samples.sample_type = 'DNA';
SELECT researchers.researcher_name, COUNT(measurements.id) AS total_measurements FROM researchers JOIN measurements ON researchers.id = measurements.researcher_id GROUP BY researchers.id;
SELECT publications.publication_title, researchers.researcher_name FROM publications JOIN researchers ON publications.researcher_id = researchers.id;
